body_text:
If you have multiple tabs open to control interfaces in different environments (local vs stage vs prod), it's hard to tell which environment you're looking at. Other projects I've worked on have had an indicator of some kind that is shown when browsing a staging or local development instance. The indicator usually states which environment you're currently viewing, and is hidden on the production instance.
Because this isn't visible on prod, we don't have/need a specific design for this. A bar at the top of the page would be fine. It might even be nice to link to the Environments documentation for that environment where possible.
A follow up feature that I think we should avoid doing for the first iteration of this is to show the status of the __heartbeat__ checks in the status bar to help notify testers if something fails during their testing. This would help catch issues like our recent signature problems that the heartbeat check caught.

title: Add status bar to control interface showing which environment is currently being browsed
body:
If you have multiple tabs open to control interfaces in different environments (local vs stage vs prod), it's hard to tell which environment you're looking at. Other projects I've worked on have had an indicator of some kind that is shown when browsing a staging or local development instance. The indicator usually states which environment you're currently viewing, and is hidden on the production instance.

Because this isn't visible on prod, we don't have/need a specific design for this. A bar at the top of the page would be fine. It might even be nice to link to the [Environments](http://normandy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/qa/environments.html) documentation for that environment where possible.

A follow up feature that I think we should avoid doing for the first iteration of this is to show the status of the `__heartbeat__` checks in the status bar to help notify testers if something fails during their testing. This would help catch issues like our recent signature problems that the heartbeat check caught.
